verses.kjv: Now there was long war between the house of Saul and the house of David: but David waxed stronger and stronger, and the house of Saul waxed weaker and weaker.
verses.ct: The conflict between Saul's family and David's family dragged on for a long time. David kept growing stronger, while Saul's side kept growing weaker.

verses.kjv: And unto David were sons born in Hebron: and his firstborn was Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess;
verses.ct: Sons were born to David while he was in Hebron. His firstborn was Amnon, whose mother was Ahinoam from Jezreel.

verses.kjv: And his second, Chileab, of Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite; and the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur;
verses.ct: His 2nd son was Chileab, whose mother was Abigail, the former wife of Nabal from Carmel. His 3rd was Absalom, whose mother was Maacah, the daughter of King Talmai of Geshur.

verses.kjv: And the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith; and the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital;
verses.ct: His 4th was Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith. His 5th was Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital.

verses.kjv: And the sixth, Ithream, by Eglah David’s wife. These were born to David in Hebron.
verses.ct: His 6th was Ithream, whose mother was Eglah, David's wife. All of these were born to David in Hebron.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while there was war between the house of Saul and the house of David, that Abner made himself strong for the house of Saul.
verses.ct: During the war between Saul's family and David's family, Abner was consolidating his own power within Saul's house.

verses.kjv: And Saul had a concubine, whose name was Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah: and Ishbosheth said to Abner, Wherefore hast thou gone in unto my father’s concubine?
verses.ct: Now Saul had a secondary wife named Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah. Ishbosheth confronted Abner, saying, "Why have you had relations with my father's secondary wife?"

verses.kjv: Then was Abner very wroth for the words of Ishbosheth, and said, Am I a dog’s head, which against Judah do shew kindness this day unto the house of Saul thy father, to his brethren, and to his friends, and have not delivered thee into the hand of David, that thou chargest me to day with a fault concerning this woman?
verses.ct: Abner became furious at Ishbosheth's accusation and said, "Am I some worthless dog from Judah? All this time I've been showing loyalty to your father Saul's family, to his brothers, and to his allies. I haven't handed you over to David. And now you accuse me over this woman?"

verses.kjv: So do God to Abner, and more also, except, as the LORD hath sworn to David, even so I do to him;
verses.ct: "May God punish me severely if I don't carry out for David exactly what the LORD promised him —

verses.kjv: To translate the kingdom from the house of Saul, and to set up the throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan even to Beersheba.
verses.ct: to transfer the kingdom away from Saul's family and establish David's throne over both Israel and Judah, from Dan all the way to Beersheba."

verses.kjv: And he could not answer Abner a word again, because he feared him.
verses.ct: Ishbosheth couldn't say another word to Abner, because he was afraid of him.

verses.kjv: And Abner sent messengers to David on his behalf, saying, Whose is the land? saying also, Make thy league with me, and, behold, my hand shall be with thee, to bring about all Israel unto thee.
verses.ct: Then Abner sent messengers to David on his own behalf, saying, "Who really controls this land? Make an alliance with me, and I will use my influence to bring all of Israel over to your side."

verses.kjv: And he said, Well; I will make a league with thee: but one thing I require of thee, that is, Thou shalt not see my face, except thou first bring Michal Saul’s daughter, when thou comest to see my face.
verses.ct: David replied, "Good — I'll make an alliance with you. But I have one condition: don't come into my presence unless you first bring Michal, Saul's daughter, when you come to meet with me."

verses.kjv: And David sent messengers to Ishbosheth Saul’s son, saying, Deliver me my wife Michal, which I espoused to me for an hundred foreskins of the Philistines.
verses.ct: David also sent messengers to Ishbosheth, Saul's son, saying, "Give me back my wife Michal, whom I earned by paying the bride price of 100 Philistine foreskins."

verses.kjv: And Ishbosheth sent, and took her from her husband, even from Phaltiel the son of Laish.
verses.ct: So Ishbosheth sent for her and took her away from her husband Phaltiel, the son of Laish.

verses.kjv: And her husband went with her along weeping behind her to Bahurim. Then said Abner unto him, Go, return. And he returned.
verses.ct: Her husband followed along behind her, weeping the whole way to Bahurim. Then Abner told him, "Go back home." So he turned back.

verses.kjv: And Abner had communication with the elders of Israel, saying, Ye sought for David in times past to be king over you:
verses.ct: Abner had been in discussions with the elders of Israel, telling them, "For a long time now, you've wanted David to be your king.

verses.kjv: Now then do it: for the LORD hath spoken of David, saying, By the hand of my servant David I will save my people Israel out of the hand of the Philistines, and out of the hand of all their enemies.
verses.ct: Now is the time to act on it, because the LORD has spoken about David, saying, 'Through my servant David, I will rescue my people Israel from the Philistines and from all their enemies.'"

verses.kjv: And Abner also spake in the ears of Benjamin: and Abner went also to speak in the ears of David in Hebron all that seemed good to Israel, and that seemed good to the whole house of Benjamin.
verses.ct: Abner also spoke personally to the people of Benjamin. Then he traveled to Hebron to tell David everything that Israel and the whole tribe of Benjamin had agreed to.

verses.kjv: So Abner came to David to Hebron, and twenty men with him. And David made Abner and the men that were with him a feast.
verses.ct: When Abner arrived in Hebron with 20 men, David prepared a feast for Abner and his companions.

verses.kjv: And Abner said unto David, I will arise and go, and will gather all Israel unto my lord the king, that they may make a league with thee, and that thou mayest reign over all that thine heart desireth. And David sent Abner away; and he went in peace.
verses.ct: Abner said to David, "Let me go and gather all of Israel for my lord the king, so they can make an alliance with you, and you can rule over everything your heart desires." So David sent Abner on his way, and he left peacefully.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the servants of David and Joab came from pursuing a troop, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.
verses.ct: Just then, David's soldiers and Joab returned from a raid, bringing back a large amount of plunder. But Abner was no longer with David in Hebron, because David had already sent him off in peace.

verses.kjv: When Joab and all the host that was with him were come, they told Joab, saying, Abner the son of Ner came to the king, and he hath sent him away, and he is gone in peace.
verses.ct: When Joab and his entire force arrived, someone informed him, "Abner son of Ner came to see the king, and the king sent him away peacefully."

verses.kjv: Then Joab came to the king, and said, What hast thou done? behold, Abner came unto thee; why is it that thou hast sent him away, and he is quite gone?
verses.ct: Joab went straight to the king and demanded, "What have you done? Abner came to you — why did you let him leave? Now he's completely gone!

verses.kjv: Thou knowest Abner the son of Ner, that he came to deceive thee, and to know thy going out and thy coming in, and to know all that thou doest.
verses.ct: You know Abner son of Ner! He came to trick you, to spy on your movements, and to find out everything you're doing."

verses.kjv: And when Joab was come out from David, he sent messengers after Abner, which brought him again from the well of Sirah: but David knew it not.
verses.ct: After Joab left David's presence, he sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the well of Sirah. David had no knowledge of this.

verses.kjv: And when Abner was returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside in the gate to speak with him quietly, and smote him there under the fifth rib, that he died, for the blood of Asahel his brother.
verses.ct: When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab pulled him aside into the gateway as if to speak with him privately. There he stabbed him in the stomach, and Abner died. This was to avenge the death of Joab's brother Asahel.

verses.kjv: And afterward when David heard it, he said, I and my kingdom are guiltless before the LORD for ever from the blood of Abner the son of Ner:
verses.ct: When David heard about it later, he declared, "My kingdom and I are completely innocent before the LORD forever regarding the death of Abner son of Ner.

verses.kjv: Let it rest on the head of Joab, and on all his father’s house; and let there not fail from the house of Joab one that hath an issue, or that is a leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that falleth on the sword, or that lacketh bread.
verses.ct: May the guilt fall on Joab and his entire family. May Joab's household never be without someone suffering from disease, or leprosy, or who walks with a crutch, or who dies by the sword, or who goes hungry."

verses.kjv: So Joab and Abishai his brother slew Abner, because he had slain their brother Asahel at Gibeon in the battle.
verses.ct: So Joab and his brother Abishai killed Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel during the battle at Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And David said to Joab, and to all the people that were with him, Rend your clothes, and gird you with sackcloth, and mourn before Abner. And king David himself followed the bier.
verses.ct: Then David told Joab and everyone with him, "Tear your clothes, put on sackcloth, and mourn for Abner." King David himself walked behind the funeral stretcher.

verses.kjv: And they buried Abner in Hebron: and the king lifted up his voice, and wept at the grave of Abner; and all the people wept.
verses.ct: They buried Abner in Hebron. The king wept loudly at Abner's grave, and all the people wept as well.

verses.kjv: And the king lamented over Abner, and said, Died Abner as a fool dieth?
verses.ct: The king sang this lament over Abner: "Should Abner have died the way a fool dies?

verses.kjv: Thy hands were not bound, nor thy feet put into fetters: as a man falleth before wicked men, so fellest thou. And all the people wept again over him.
verses.ct: Your hands were never tied, your feet were never chained. You fell the way someone falls at the hands of violent men." Then all the people wept over him again.

verses.kjv: And when all the people came to cause David to eat meat while it was yet day, David sware, saying, So do God to me, and more also, if I taste bread, or ought else, till the sun be down.
verses.ct: The people came to urge David to eat something while it was still daylight, but David made an oath: "May God punish me severely if I eat bread or anything else before the sun goes down."

verses.kjv: And all the people took notice of it, and it pleased them: as whatsoever the king did pleased all the people.
verses.ct: Everyone noticed this, and it pleased them. In fact, everything the king did pleased the people.

verses.kjv: For all the people and all Israel understood that day that it was not of the king to slay Abner the son of Ner.
verses.ct: That day, all the people and all of Israel recognized that the king had nothing to do with the killing of Abner son of Ner.

verses.kjv: And the king said unto his servants, Know ye not that there is a prince and a great man fallen this day in Israel?
verses.ct: The king said to his officials, "Don't you realize that a leader and a great man has fallen today in Israel?

verses.kjv: And I am this day weak, though anointed king; and these men the sons of Zeruiah be too hard for me: the LORD shall reward the doer of evil according to his wickedness.
verses.ct: Even though I am the anointed king, I feel powerless right now. These sons of Zeruiah are too ruthless for me. May the LORD repay the one who does evil according to his wickedness."
